data.title: Always a great evening
data.text: My wife and I have attended many shows here and absolutely love it, a little disappointing that they have stopped the "dinner theater" aspect, but we completely understand, they need not be in the food business. They have expanded the seating now with additional cabaret tables so there is more room for larger crowds. The decor is beautiful and the staff is wonderful. We look forward to many more years of attending and supporting local theater and local artists.They have such a variety of shows from Fiddler on the Roof to Legally Blonde and even Mary Poppins, there is something for everyone.  By all means make sure this is one of the places you visit when you come to the area, and if your local visit the APT often, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great venue!
data.text: Been to several shows here the last few months.  They do a great job!  Not a bad seat in the house!  The staff is very helpful and courteous.

data.title: Great little theater
data.text: My husband surprised me with tickets to a Saturday night show at Rogers Little Theater.  The employees were friendly and helpful.  It's small so there aren't a lot of refreshments available for purchase but there are some.  They offer a dinner option if you're interested when purchasing tickets.  We sat in the balcony which was a little cool, though it was winter and evening in an old downtown building.  Support your local community theater and give RLT a try.

data.title: Great theater
data.text: Lights, Action, Live Music, Scenery, Costume Changes, Great Scripts ...dinner theater at its best and opportunities for talented individuals of all ages.  We've seen several productions and all have been top notch!

data.title: Wonderfully entertaining performances
data.text:
These performers will make you forget that you are not on Broadway.
Amazing how the directors bring this out. Hey, some great local talent as well.

data.title: Entertainment Live!
data.text: We have season tickets and we can say every show we have seen has been a blast.  The venue is very cozy, especially if you chose the cabaret seating.  Ticketing has never been easier with APT's electronic ticket.  Just walk in give them your name and they will take you to your table or seat. They also serve beverages of your choice, moderately priced.  If you are looking for a fun evening just go on line and order your tickets for the next show.  The talent in this little theatre will blow you away.

data.title: The APT, as it is now known, is the best place to experience live theater in Northwest Arkansas.
data.text: My wife and I have had tickets to the Broadway series at the Walton Arts Center and while we have always enjoyed the shows there I can honestly say that the production values and talent on display at the RLT rival if not surpass what you will see there. Come see a show. Success breads success and the RLT has developed a very strong following among a very talented group of performers. Come see a show you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Nice little date night spot!
data.text: We've seen several performances over the past few years at RLT, and they have all been great. The dinner theater option is neat to try out (and romantic!), and for a cheaper option opt for the balcony seats. There really are no bad seats in the theater as it is quite small; the size makes it feel like you are "in" the storyline!

data.title: Great Home Town Theater
data.text: Great little home town theater that has top notch shows for the size and great staff that are very helpful. Shows are limited and the price is usually very reasonable.

data.title: Community Theater in Historic Building
data.text: I've seen quite a few performances at the Rogers Little Theater over the past few years.  From the 'big name' shows you know and love, to some lesser-known plays, the production quality is always high.  There's a lot of talent in this area and you see it come together onstage.  The building is historic and beautiful.  The staff and volunteers are always friendly and helpful.  Depending on the show, it could be a great date night or a family night out.  I'm looking forward to seeing what they do in the future!
